intro: Rhodiola handelii, commonly known as the Tibetan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to cold, arid environments and thrives in rocky, mountainous regions. Rhodiola handelii is known for its high concentration of secondary metabolites, including rosavins and salidrosate, which contribute to its reputation as an adaptogen. Its botanical features make it well-suited for survival in extreme climates and have led to its use in traditional medicine.
